text: Lorisidae (sometimes called Loridae) is a family of primates. Its members resemble lemurs. They live in trees, in Africa and Asia. Depending on the author, there are nine to eleven species, in about five genera. Brandon-Jones D. et al 2004. Asian primate classification. International Journal of Primatology. 25 (1): 100. Genera are: Arctocebus Perodicticus Pseudopotto Loris Nycticebus ==References== Category:Lorisoidea
title: Lorisidae
